name: Morningside Nature Preserve
snippet: 30 acres of conserved forest northeast of Piedmont Park.

name: Piedmont Park
snippet: Piedmont is Atlanta’s most well known park. 189 acres rich in history and lots of amenities.

name: Central Park
snippet: 17 acre park in Old Fourth Ward featuring a variety of athletic and multi-purpose fields/courts.

name: Renaissance Park
snippet: 5 acre park in Old Fourth Ward with walking paths and a dog park.

name: Constitution Lakes
snippet: Constitution Lakes is a 125 acre wetlands nature preserve in south east Atlanta, with trails, boardwalks, and repurposed art.

name: Cheshire Farm Trail
snippet: A short trail that snakes alongside North Fork Peachtree Creek and underneath I-85.

name: Oakland Cemetery
snippet: Atlanta's iconic cemetery serves as the resting place for numerous famous Atlantans including Bobby Jones, Margaret Mitchell, and Maynard Jackson.

name: Cascade Springs Nature Preserve
snippet: 120 acre nature preserve in southwest Atlanta featuring trails and a waterfall.

name: Tech Green
snippet: Central greenspace on Georgia Tech Campus

name: Couch Park (Burger Bowl)
snippet: A small park on west side of Georgia Tech's campus primarily used as a multi-purpose field by Tech students.

name: Orme Park
snippet: A small community park with a playground and walking paths.

name: Winn Park
snippet: A medium sized park in Ansley Park neighborhood featuring a playground and multi-purpose field with a backstop.

name: Historic Fourth Ward Park
snippet: 17 acre park in Old Fourth Ward behind of Ponce City Market

name: Centennial Olympic Park
snippet: Large Olympic park in downtown Atlanta surrounded by popular Atlanta attractions.

name: Freedom Park
snippet: A large sprawling park that stretches from Candler Park to downtown.

name: Lullwater Creek Park
snippet: 154 acre preserve on Emory’s campus. Includes a number of trails that weave throughout the forest around Candler Lake.

name: Sweetwater Creek State Park
snippet: 2,500 acre state park just west of the city. Hiking, camping, and fishing on the menu.

name: Arabia Mountain
snippet: A 'mini Stone Mountain' just south of Lithonia, Arabia Mountain offers over 2,550 acres of exposed granite, forests, and wetland.

name: Selena S. Butler Park
snippet: A 4 acre park in Old 4th Ward with a playground, grills, tennis and basketball courts.

name: Esther Peachey Lefevre Park
snippet: A small corner park in Cabbagetown with a playground.

name: Cabbagetown Park
snippet: A medium-sized community park in Cabbagetown known for hosting the annual Chomp and Stomp chilli cook-off.

name: Cleopas R. Johnson Park
snippet: Medium sized park in between castleberry hill and the AUC. Basketball court, tennis courts and playground.

name: Parkway-Wabash Park
snippet: Small corner park in Old 4th Ward with a basketball court and small playground.

name: Murphey Candler Park
snippet: 135 acre park in Brookhaven featuring walking trails, a lake, and sports fields.

name: Parkway-Angier Park
snippet: A small corner park in the Old 4th Ward.

name: Candler Park
snippet: A 55 acre park on the east-side of Atlanta the includes a 9-hole golf course, pool, playground, and sports amenities.

name: Zonolite Park
snippet: A 13 acre park near Emory that has a grassy meadow and trails along South Fork Peachtree Creek.

name: Lenox-Wildwood Park
snippet: A narrow park in Morningside that includes 2 tennis courts alongside a small creek.
